field.label: Servers
field.help: Select the OpenVPN servers where this override applies to, leave empty for all

field.label: Description
field.help: You may enter a description here for your reference (not parsed).

field.label: Common name
field.help: Enter the client's X.509 common name here.

field.label: Connection blocking
field.help: Block this client connection based on its common name. Don't use this option to permanently disable a client due to a compromised key or password. Use a CRL (certificate revocation list) instead.

field.label: Push reset
field.help: Don't inherit the global push list for a specific client instance. NOTE: --push-reset is very thorough: it will remove almost all options from the list of to-be-pushed options. In many cases, some of these options will need to be re-configured afterwards - specifically, --topology subnet and --route-gateway will get lost and this will break client configs in many cases.

field.label: IPv4 Tunnel Network
field.help: Push virtual IP endpoints for client tunnel, overriding dynamic allocation.

field.label: IPv6 Tunnel Network
field.help: Push virtual IP endpoints for client tunnel, overriding dynamic allocation.

field.label: Local Network
field.help: These are the networks accessible by the client, these are pushed via route{-ipv6} clauses in OpenVPN to the client.

field.label: Remote Network
field.help: Remote networks for the server, these are configured via iroute{-ipv6} clauses in OpenVPN and inform the server to send these networks to this specific client.

field.label: Route gateway
field.help: Specify a default gateway to use for the connected client. Without one set the first address in the netblock is being offered. When segmenting the tunnel (server) network, this one might not be accessible from the client.

field.label: Redirect gateway
field.help: Automatically execute routing commands to cause all outgoing IP traffic to be redirected over the VPN.

field.label: Register DNS
field.help: Run ipconfig /flushdns and ipconfig /registerdns on connection initiation. This is known to kick Windows into recognizing pushed DNS servers.

field.label: DNS Domain search list
field.help: Add name to the domain search list. Repeat this option to add more entries. Up to 10 domains are supported.

field.label: DNS Servers
field.help: Set primary domain name server IPv4 or IPv6 address. Repeat this option to set secondary DNS server addresses.

field.label: NTP Servers
field.help: Set primary NTP server address (Network Time Protocol). Repeat this option to set secondary NTP server addresses.

field.label: WINS Servers
field.help: Set primary WINS server address (NetBIOS over TCP/IP Name Server). Repeat this option to set secondary WINS server addresses.
